resources.string: Task Journal will now be able to receive your phone interaction events such as click, back, home.
Permission required to access interaction with phone.
We do not collect any sensitive data. We just use this to infer interaction with phone.
Click the button below to open your accessibility settings page. Once you\'re there, enable/reset the app permission and click back button.
Permission required to access interaction with apps.
We just use this to infer acceptance and dismissal of a notification by checking if the corresponding app was launched.
Click the button below to open your app settings page. Once you\'re there, enable/reset the app permission and click back button.
We do not collect any sensitive data and all data are anonymised.
Click the button below to open your notification settings page. Once you\'re there, enable/reset the app permission and click back button.

Task Journal helps you to keep track of your task completion everyday. The app will trigger one self-report diary questionnaire every day. All the personal information will be anonymised, securely transmitted and stored on the server. No additional information related to contacts \(telephone numbers, email addresses etc.\) on your device or history of communication made with the contact would be collected by the application. The app is developed to collect data for research at University of Birmingham.
\n\n
By agreeing to the consent below, I confirm that I am over 18 years of age and allow the app to collect my data. I also confirm that I am the sole prominent user of this device. I understand that access to any data collected will only be allowed to me and the researchers team at University of Birmingham. Any published results of this study will only refer to anonymised and obfuscated data, and aggregated statistics that do not reveal the identities of the participants. As a participant, I have the right to opt out of the data collection at any time during this experiment by uninstalling the application. Moreover, I have the right to access any information in the data set related to me, and request for any part of that data to be removed.
You have not completed self-report diary for today.
Good job! You have completed self-report diary for today. You can do it again tomorrow.

Do you know that tracking your task regularly could improve your productivity? We will help you form a good habit of tracking your task every day by creating a plan called as implementation intention.


Implementation intention is effective in helping form new habits by specifying the condition to perform your intended habit.


Tap the button below to start.

This is your implementation intention. Now follow these steps:


1. Read your implementation intention below
 2. Repeat it twice in your head
 3. Close your eyes and imagine
Now, fill in the blank space with a condition that trigger your action
Fabulous! You are good to go. Once again, remember your implementation intention below:
Nah, you are wrong! Your implementation intention should be below. Remember this implementation intention and now you are all set.

Follow these steps:


1. Read your implementation intention below
 2. Repeat it twice in your head
 3. Close your eyes and imagine
If I am about going to bed at the night, then I will complete self-report diary
Please indicate how do you feel about finishing self-report diary every day. Choose the appropriate response for each item.
Brilliant! Now, you are all set up. Don\'t forget your implementation intention: If I %1$s, then I will complete self-report diary.
You cannot go back to change your answer. It is mandatory to complete the test in one go. So, take your time and try to answer the questions as accurate as possible.

string-array.name: gcs_questions
string-array.item: I am strongly committed to pursuing this goal.
I think this is a good goal to aim for.
It would not take much to make me abandon this goal.
Quite frankly, I do not care if I achieve this goal or not.
It is hard to take this goal seriously.

resources.string: Please answer the following questions by choosing the right scale that represents your perception towards completing a self-report diary as your activity.

You cannot go back to change your answer. It is mandatory to complete the test in one go. So, take your time and try to answer the questions as accurate as possible.
\n\n Note that this test uses SRBAI questionnaire to measure automaticity of behaviour, developed by Gardner et. al. (2012).
Thank you!

string-array.name: srbai_questions
string-array.item: I complete self-report diary without having to consciously remember.
I complete self-report diary without thinking.
I start completing self-report diary before I realise I am doing it.

resources.string: Please enable permission requests for read/write access to local storage. We need read/write access permission to store the data in your phone, before transmitting securely into our server.
